sites.name: White Tower
sites.description: The iconic 72-meter high White Tower is the symbol of Hradec Kralove and the tallest building in the city. Built in the 16th century as a bell tower, it offers panoramic views of the city and surrounding countryside. The tower houses the city's largest bell, Augustin, and features an exhibition about the tower's history.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round; beautiful views in all seasons. Summer offers longer opening hours.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available at the entrance. Climbing the 233 steps is required - not suitable for those with mobility issues.

sites.name: Holy Spirit Cathedral
sites.description: A magnificent Gothic cathedral dating from the 14th century, featuring stunning architecture and beautiful stained glass windows. The cathedral is the seat of the Hradec Kralove diocese and contains valuable religious artifacts and artwork.
sites.seasonal_notes: Open year-round for services and visitors. Christmas and Easter services are particularly atmospheric.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Check service times before visiting. Photography may be restricted during services.

sites.name: Great Square (Velké náměstí)
sites.description: The historic heart of Hradec Kralove, featuring beautiful Renaissance and Baroque architecture. The square is surrounded by colorful historic buildings and is the site of the city's main market and cultural events throughout the year.
sites.seasonal_notes: Christmas markets in winter; outdoor cafes and events in summer. Beautiful architecture visible year-round.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Visit early morning for photos without crowds.

sites.name: East Bohemian Museum
sites.description: Comprehensive museum showcasing the history and culture of East Bohemia. Features archaeological finds, historical artifacts, and rotating exhibitions about the region's rich heritage from prehistoric times to the present.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for rainy days. Special exhibitions change seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available at entrance. Student discounts available. Check website for current exhibitions.

sites.name: Galerie moderního umění
sites.description: Gallery of Modern Art featuring contemporary Czech and international artwork. The gallery hosts temporary exhibitions and has a permanent collection of 20th and 21st century art, including works by prominent Czech artists.
sites.seasonal_notes: Indoor attraction perfect for any weather. Exhibition schedule varies throughout the year.
sites.booking_tips: Check website for current exhibitions. Student discounts available.

sites.name: Jirásek Gardens
sites.description: Beautiful public gardens named after Czech writer Alois Jirásek. The gardens feature walking paths, flower beds, and a peaceful atmosphere perfect for relaxation. Popular spot for locals and visitors alike.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most beautiful in spring and summer when flowers are in bloom. Autumn offers colorful foliage.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Perfect for a peaceful stroll or picnic.

sites.name: Klicper Theatre
sites.description: Historic theater building dating from the 19th century, named after Czech playwright Václav Kliment Klicpera. The theater hosts performances of drama, opera, and ballet, and is an important cultural venue in the city.
sites.seasonal_notes: Performance schedule varies throughout the year. Book tickets in advance for popular shows.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets available online or at box office. Check performance schedule in advance.

sites.name: Orlické Mountains Viewpoint
sites.description: Scenic viewpoint offering panoramic views of the Orlické Mountains and the surrounding countryside. Located on the outskirts of the city, it's a popular spot for photography and enjoying the natural beauty of the region.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best views on clear days. Beautiful in all seasons, especially autumn when mountains are colorful.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Accessible by car or hiking trails.

sites.name: Brewery Museum
sites.description: Interactive museum showcasing the history of brewing in the region. Features historical brewing equipment, exhibits on beer production, and tastings of local craft beers. Learn about the traditional brewing methods and modern craft beer scene.
sites.seasonal_notes: Indoor attraction perfect for any weather. Beer tastings available year-round.
sites.booking_tips: Book guided tours in advance. Tasting sessions require separate tickets.

sites.name: Adalbertinum
sites.description: Historic cultural center housed in a beautiful Art Nouveau building. Hosts concerts, exhibitions, and cultural events throughout the year. The building itself is an architectural gem worth admiring.
sites.seasonal_notes: Event schedule varies throughout the year. Check calendar for current offerings.
sites.booking_tips: Tickets for events available online or at box office. Building tours available by appointment.

neighborhoods.name: Great Square (Velké náměstí)
neighborhoods.character: The historic heart of Hradec Kralove, featuring beautiful Renaissance and Baroque architecture with a vibrant market atmosphere.

location.description: Located in the center of the old town, surrounded by historic buildings and the main market area.

history.overview: The historic center of Hradec Kralove, dating back to medieval times when it served as the main market square.
history.significance: Home to the city's most important historic buildings and the traditional center of civic life.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant activity and good lighting.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for market activity, evening for dining and atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with pedestrian-friendly streets and squares.

attractions.name: White Tower
attractions.description: The iconic 72-meter high tower offering panoramic views of the city.
attractions.appeal: Climb the 233 steps for the best views of Hradec Kralove.

attractions.name: Holy Spirit Cathedral
attractions.description: Magnificent 14th-century cathedral with stunning architecture and religious significance.
attractions.appeal: Experience the spiritual heart of the city with beautiful stained glass.

attractions.name: Great Square Market
attractions.description: Traditional market offering fresh produce, local specialties, and crafts.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic Czech market culture and local life.

dining.name: Restaurant U Labutě

activities.name: Historic Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore the historic architecture and learn about the city's rich history.

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Browse fresh produce, local crafts, and traditional Czech goods.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of historic Hradec Kralove
You enjoy traditional Czech culture and architecture
insider_tips: Visit the market early morning for the freshest produce and fewest crowds.
Climb the White Tower at sunset for the most beautiful views.

neighborhoods.name: University District
neighborhoods.character: A vibrant area centered around the University of Hradec Kralove, known for its youthful energy and cultural activities.

history.overview: Developed around the university's establishment, becoming a hub for education and student life.
history.significance: Center of academic life and cultural innovation in the city.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with a large student population and good lighting.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Academic year for vibrant student atmosphere.
practical_info.walkability: Excellent with pedestrian-friendly campus and surrounding areas.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with a family-friendly residential atmosphere.
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring and summer for garden beauty, autumn for colorful foliage.

local_specialties.description: Czech national dish of marinated beef sirloin with cream sauce, bread dumplings, and cranberry sauce.
Hearty beef stew with onions, paprika, and Czech bread dumplings.
Traditional Czech dish featuring tender pork with fermented cabbage and bread dumplings.
Various types of traditional Czech sausages, often served with mustard and bread.
Traditional Czech side dish made from stale bread, served with meat dishes and gravy.
Sweet pastry filled with apples, nuts, or other fruits, a traditional Czech dessert.

drinks.name: Czech Beer
drinks.description: Czech Republic has the highest beer consumption per capita. Try Pilsner Urquell, Budvar, or local craft beers from East Bohemia.

drinks.name: Becherovka
drinks.description: Traditional Czech herbal liqueur from Karlovy Vary, often served as a digestif.

drinks.name: Moravian Wine
drinks.description: Quality wines from the nearby Moravian region, particularly white wines and ice wines.

drinks.name: Slivovitz
drinks.description: Traditional Czech plum brandy, often homemade and served as a strong digestif.

destinations.whyGo: Czech Republic's stunning capital with medieval old town, Prague Castle, and vibrant cultural scene.
Czech Republic's second largest city with modern architecture, vibrant cultural scene, and excellent museums.
Medieval fairy-tale town with stunning castle and UNESCO World Heritage old town.
Historic university city with beautiful baroque architecture and UNESCO-listed Holy Trinity Column.
Gateway to the Jizera Mountains with beautiful architecture, excellent skiing, and outdoor activities.
Famous for Pilsner beer, historic center, and excellent breweries and beer culture.
Industrial heritage city with unique mining history, modern architecture, and vibrant cultural scene.
Dynamic Polish capital with rich history, excellent museums, and vibrant cultural scene.
Historic Polish city with stunning medieval old town, Wawel Castle, and rich cultural heritage.
Imperial capital with magnificent palaces, world-class museums, and elegant coffee house culture.
Charming Slovak capital with historic old town, hilltop castle, and Danube River setting.
Stunning architecture, thermal baths, vibrant nightlife, and rich cultural heritage.
Dynamic capital blending history and modernity with vibrant arts and nightlife scene.
Beautiful baroque architecture, world-class museums, and rich cultural heritage.
Historic Polish city with beautiful market square, Gothic architecture, and vibrant cultural scene.

activities.name: Easter Markets at Great Square
activities.description: Experience traditional Czech Easter markets in the Great Square, featuring hand-painted eggs, local crafts, and seasonal treats like mazanec (Easter bread).
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring brings the city to life with Easter traditions and blooming flowers throughout the city.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning for the best selection of traditional Easter decorations and fewer crowds.

activities.name: Jirásek Gardens Spring Bloom
activities.description: Witness the beautiful spring bloom in Jirásek Gardens, where cherry blossoms, tulips, and other spring flowers create a colorful display.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring is the perfect time to enjoy the gardens as they come alive with new growth and blooming flowers.
activities.booking_tips: Bring a picnic and enjoy the peaceful atmosphere away from the city center.

activities.name: University Cultural Festival
activities.description: Attend the annual University Cultural Festival featuring student performances, art exhibitions, and academic events throughout the university district.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring marks the end of the academic year with vibrant cultural celebrations.
activities.booking_tips: Check the university calendar for specific event schedules and locations.

activities.name: East Bohemian Museum Spring Exhibitions
activities.description: Explore special spring exhibitions at the East Bohemian Museum, featuring local history, archaeology, and rotating cultural displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring exhibitions often focus on local traditions and seasonal themes.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays for a quieter experience and check for guided tours.

activities.name: White Tower Spring Views
activities.description: Climb the White Tower for panoramic spring views of the city and surrounding countryside, with the landscape coming alive with new growth.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring offers clear views and comfortable temperatures for the 233-step climb.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early morning for the best lighting and fewer crowds.

activities.name: Local Beer Garden Opening
activities.description: Enjoy the opening of outdoor beer gardens throughout the city, serving local Czech beers and traditional pub food.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring evenings are perfect for outdoor beer garden experiences with mild temperatures.
activities.booking_tips: Try local craft beers and traditional Czech pub snacks.

activities.name: Spring Walking Tours
activities.description: Join guided walking tours of the historic center, learning about the city's rich history while enjoying the pleasant spring weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring weather is ideal for walking tours with comfortable temperatures and blooming gardens.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance and wear comfortable walking shoes.

activities.name: Student Art Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit student art exhibitions at the university and local galleries, showcasing emerging talent and contemporary Czech art.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring showcases student work and new artistic developments in the city.
activities.booking_tips: Check university and gallery websites for exhibition schedules and opening hours.

activities.name: Spring Market Shopping
activities.description: Explore the Great Square market for fresh spring produce, local crafts, and seasonal specialties from East Bohemia.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring markets feature fresh local produce and traditional Czech goods.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for the best selection of fresh produce and local specialties.

activities.name: Hradec Kralove Summer Festival
activities.description: Experience the annual summer music festival featuring classical concerts, jazz performances, and cultural events throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings are perfect for outdoor concerts and cultural performances.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets in advance for popular performances and check the festival schedule.

activities.name: Outdoor Beer Gardens
activities.description: Enjoy traditional Czech beer in beautiful outdoor beer gardens throughout the city, with local brews and pub food.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is the peak season for outdoor beer garden experiences with warm evenings.
activities.booking_tips: Try local craft beers and traditional Czech pub snacks like pickled cheese.

activities.name: Jirásek Gardens Summer Concerts
activities.description: Attend open-air concerts in the beautiful Jirásek Gardens, featuring local musicians and classical performances.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings provide the perfect setting for outdoor musical performances.
activities.booking_tips: Bring a blanket or chair and arrive early to secure a good spot.

activities.name: City Center Walking Tours
activities.description: Explore the historic city center on guided walking tours, learning about the city's architecture and history in pleasant summer weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers long daylight hours perfect for comprehensive city exploration.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance and wear comfortable walking shoes and sun protection.

activities.name: Local Craft Beer Tasting
activities.description: Sample local craft beers from East Bohemian breweries at various pubs and beer gardens throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer is ideal for beer tasting with refreshing local brews and outdoor seating.
activities.booking_tips: Visit multiple pubs to compare different local craft beers and traditional Czech lagers.

activities.name: University Campus Tours
activities.description: Explore the modern university campus and its beautiful architecture, learning about the city's academic heritage.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers pleasant weather for campus exploration with fewer students present.
activities.booking_tips: Contact the university for guided tours or explore independently during summer break.

activities.name: East Bohemian Museum Special Exhibitions
activities.description: Visit special summer exhibitions at the East Bohemian Museum, featuring local history and cultural displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer exhibitions often focus on local traditions and seasonal themes.
activities.booking_tips: Check for special summer programs and guided tours.

activities.name: Great Square Evening Markets
activities.description: Experience evening markets in the Great Square, featuring local crafts, food stalls, and live entertainment.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer evenings create a vibrant atmosphere for market shopping and socializing.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekends for the most lively atmosphere and entertainment.

activities.name: Cultural District Art Walks
activities.description: Explore the cultural district's galleries and art spaces, featuring contemporary Czech art and rotating exhibitions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers extended gallery hours and special art events.
activities.booking_tips: Check gallery websites for current exhibitions and special events.

activities.name: Autumn Foliage in Jirásek Gardens
activities.description: Experience the beautiful autumn colors in Jirásek Gardens, with golden leaves creating a picturesque setting for peaceful walks.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers stunning fall colors and comfortable temperatures for outdoor activities.
activities.booking_tips: Visit in the afternoon for the best lighting for photography of the autumn foliage.

activities.name: Hradec Kralove Autumn Festival
activities.description: Attend the annual autumn festival featuring traditional Czech music, dance performances, and cultural celebrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn festivals celebrate Czech culture and traditions with seasonal themes.
activities.booking_tips: Check the festival schedule for specific events and performances.

activities.name: East Bohemian Museum Autumn Exhibitions
activities.description: Explore autumn-themed exhibitions at the East Bohemian Museum, featuring local history and seasonal cultural displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn exhibitions often focus on harvest traditions and local history.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays for a quieter experience and check for special autumn programs.

activities.name: Traditional Czech Cooking Classes
activities.description: Learn to cook traditional Czech autumn dishes like goulash, svíčková, and seasonal pastries with local ingredients.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn provides a bounty of local ingredients for traditional Czech cooking.
activities.booking_tips: Book classes in advance, especially for popular traditional cooking workshops.

activities.name: University Cultural Events
activities.description: Attend university cultural events and performances, featuring student talent and academic celebrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn marks the beginning of the academic year with cultural events and performances.
activities.booking_tips: Check the university calendar for specific events and performance schedules.

activities.name: Local Wine Tasting
activities.description: Sample local wines from the nearby Moravian region at wine bars and restaurants throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn is harvest season, making it an ideal time for wine tasting and appreciation.
activities.booking_tips: Visit wine bars in the evening and ask for recommendations of local Moravian wines.

activities.name: Historic Walking Tours
activities.description: Join guided walking tours of the historic center, learning about the city's rich history in pleasant autumn weather.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn offers comfortable temperatures and beautiful scenery for walking tours.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours in advance and wear comfortable walking shoes for autumn weather.

activities.name: Autumn Market Shopping
activities.description: Explore the Great Square market for autumn produce, local crafts, and seasonal specialties from East Bohemia.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn markets feature harvest produce and traditional Czech goods.
activities.booking_tips: Visit early for the best selection of fresh autumn produce and local specialties.

activities.name: Klicper Theatre Performances
activities.description: Attend performances at the historic Klicper Theatre, featuring drama, opera, and ballet in a beautiful historic venue.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn evenings are perfect for indoor cultural performances and theater experiences.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets in advance for popular performances and check the theater schedule.

activities.name: Christmas Markets at Great Square
activities.description: Experience magical Christmas markets in the Great Square, featuring traditional Czech crafts, mulled wine, and festive decorations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter Christmas markets create a magical atmosphere with festive lights and traditional Czech treats.
activities.booking_tips: Visit in the evening for the best atmosphere and to see the festive lights and decorations.

activities.name: White Tower Winter Views
activities.description: Climb the White Tower for panoramic winter views of the snow-covered city and surrounding countryside.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers unique snowy views and fewer crowds for the tower climb.
activities.booking_tips: Dress warmly for the climb and visit early for the best winter lighting.

activities.name: East Bohemian Museum Winter Exhibitions
activities.description: Explore winter-themed exhibitions at the East Bohemian Museum, featuring local history and seasonal cultural displays.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter exhibitions often focus on local traditions and seasonal themes.
activities.booking_tips: Visit on weekdays for a quieter experience and check for special winter programs.

activities.name: Traditional Czech Christmas Dinner
activities.description: Enjoy traditional Czech Christmas dinner at local restaurants, featuring dishes like carp, potato salad, and Christmas cookies.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect time to experience traditional Czech Christmas cuisine and customs.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables in advance for Christmas dinner, especially on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.

activities.name: Klicper Theatre Christmas Performances
activities.description: Attend special Christmas performances at the historic Klicper Theatre, featuring traditional Czech plays and seasonal entertainment.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter evenings are perfect for indoor cultural performances and Christmas entertainment.
activities.booking_tips: Book tickets well in advance for popular Christmas performances and special events.

activities.name: Hot Chocolate at Local Cafés
activities.description: Warm up with traditional Czech hot chocolate and pastries at local cafés throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is the perfect season for enjoying warm beverages and traditional Czech pastries.
activities.booking_tips: Visit cafés during off-peak times to avoid crowds, especially on weekends.

activities.name: Indoor Art Gallery Visits
activities.description: Explore local art galleries and the Galerie moderního umění, featuring contemporary Czech art and rotating exhibitions.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter offers a cozy retreat for indoor art appreciation and cultural enrichment.
activities.booking_tips: Check gallery websites for current exhibitions and special winter events.

activities.name: Traditional Czech Beer Tasting
activities.description: Sample traditional Czech beers and seasonal brews at local pubs and beer halls throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter is ideal for cozy pub experiences with traditional Czech beer and hearty pub food.
activities.booking_tips: Visit multiple pubs to compare different Czech beers and try seasonal winter brews.

activities.name: New Year's Eve Celebrations
activities.description: Celebrate New Year's Eve in the Great Square with fireworks, live music, and festive celebrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter New Year's celebrations create a magical atmosphere with fireworks and festive events.
activities.booking_tips: Arrive early to secure a good spot for fireworks and dress warmly for outdoor celebrations.

ranges.notes: Major holiday - most attractions closed, cold weather (-2 to 2°C), post-celebration cleanup, limited transport
considerations: Excellent for photography with fewer crowds

ranges.notes: Post-holiday recovery, gradual reopening, winter sales begin, very cold (-3 to 3°C)
Coldest period (-5 to 2°C), possible snow, ideal for indoor activities, very low tourism
Winter continues, cold (-2 to 4°C), fewer crowds, excellent museum time
Pre-Valentine's period, gradual warming (0 to 6°C), winter sales ending

schoolHolidays.description: Winter school holidays - increased family tourism

ranges.notes: Romantic atmosphere, special dining events, busy restaurants, book 2-3 weeks ahead
Post-Valentine's, school holidays continue, gradually warming (1 to 7°C), spring hints
Early spring transition, variable weather (3 to 10°C), increasing daylight
Spring awakening, pleasant temperatures (5 to 12°C), perfect for walking
Spring officially arrives, excellent conditions (6 to 13°C), Easter preparations begin
Fun cultural atmosphere, spring flowers peak, perfect spring weather
ranges.culturalTradition: Czech April Fool's traditions, playful atmosphere throughout the city

ranges.notes: Easter markets in full swing, spring flowers in spectacular bloom, ideal weather (8 to 15°C), photography paradise
considerations: Easter is major holiday in Czech Republic

ranges.notes: Perfect spring conditions (10 to 16°C), comfortable temperatures, ideal sightseeing

specialConsiderations.easter: Major Christian holiday affects opening hours and creates family tourism spike
specialConsiderations.schoolHolidays: Two weeks of increased family tourism from all regions
specialConsiderations.weather: Most stable spring weather but sudden showers possible

ranges.notes: Many closures but special events, spring celebrations
Spring flowers, pleasant temperatures (10 to 18°C), outdoor dining
Free museum access, special cultural events, perfect weather
Warm weather (12 to 20°C), outdoor café culture thriving, long days
Excellent weather (13 to 22°C), long daylight, pre-peak season
Warming up, tourism increasing, still manageable crowds
Music festival, summer solstice, free concerts everywhere
Summer begins, increasing tourism, warm weather (15 to 23°C)
Peak tourism season, warm weather (15 to 24°C), crowded attractions
French cultural celebrations, fireworks, special events
Summer festival season, hot weather (16 to 25°C), peak tourism, crowded
Hot weather (16 to 25°C), outdoor festivals, many locals on vacation, some closures
Still warm, crowds decreasing as European vacations end, more manageable
Excellent post-peak season, warm weather continues (12 to 20°C), fewer crowds
Pleasant temperatures, reduced crowds, cultural events, university activities
Cultural festival, fall colors beginning, cultural events
Comfortable temperatures (8 to 15°C), beautiful autumn atmosphere, golden light
Fall colors, harvest activities, wine tasting, autumn charm
Holiday, some closures but special cemetery visits, chrysanthemums
Fall colors continue, cooling temperatures (4 to 10°C), indoor activities
Commemorations, some closures, historical significance
Festive atmosphere begins, cooler weather, holiday preparations
Festive atmosphere, holiday decorations, mulled wine, seasonal treats
Holiday events, Christmas shopping crowds, festive lights
Many closures but special atmosphere, family celebrations
Between Christmas and New Year's - busy tourist period, sales begin
Special events but very crowded, champagne celebrations

scoreDescription.1: Poor: Unfavorable conditions, extreme weather, overcrowded or limited activities, poor value
scoreDescription.2: Below Average: Less ideal conditions, possibly unpleasant weather or very high crowds, limited value
scoreDescription.3: Average: Standard conditions, typical weather, moderate to high tourism, fair value
scoreDescription.4: Good: Very favorable conditions, pleasant weather, manageable crowds, good value
scoreDescription.5: Excellent: Perfect conditions, special events, ideal weather, moderate crowds, best value

seasonal.winter: Traditional Czech Christmas dinner, comfort food

public.strikes: Possible any time, more common autumn/winter

valuePricing.strategy: Book 2-3 months ahead for best rates

accommodation.airConditioning: Essential July-August, many historic hotels lack AC

closures.august: Many local restaurants close for owner vacations
closures.holidays: Christmas Day, New Year's Day, Easter Sunday
closures.sunday: Many traditional restaurants closed Sunday evening

monthlyHighlights.january: Winter sales, cozy museums, authentic local experience
monthlyHighlights.february: Valentine's romance, fewer crowds, cultural immersion
monthlyHighlights.march: Spring awakening, Easter preparations, perfect temperatures
monthlyHighlights.april: Easter markets peak, ideal weather, spring celebrations
monthlyHighlights.may: Perfect conditions, Museum Day, optimal sightseeing
monthlyHighlights.june: Longest days, Music Festival, pre-peak crowds
monthlyHighlights.july: Peak summer, cultural festivals, outdoor activities
monthlyHighlights.august: Hot weather, summer festivals, many locals away
monthlyHighlights.september: Post-peak perfection, cultural season, ideal conditions
monthlyHighlights.october: Autumn beauty, cultural festival, comfortable temperatures
monthlyHighlights.november: Cozy atmosphere, Christmas markets begin, cultural season
monthlyHighlights.december: Christmas magic, holiday markets, festive atmosphere

weatherNotes.spring: Variable weather, layers recommended, occasional rain
weatherNotes.summer: Warm to hot, occasional heatwaves, evening thunderstorms possible
weatherNotes.autumn: Gradually cooling, beautiful colors, comfortable for walking
weatherNotes.winter: Cold but rarely extreme, occasional snow, indoor activities recommended

transportation.walking: Best in spring and autumn, challenging in extreme weather
transportation.cycling: Excellent in spring and autumn, bike lanes available
transportation.taxis: Available year-round, more expensive in peak season

accommodation.advanceBooking: Recommended 3-6 months ahead for peak season
